bug.short_desc: Cyrus IMAP does not compile against net-snmp 5.x

long_desc.thetext:
It appears that Cyrus IMAP requires libsnmp instead of libnetsnmp (ucd-snmp versus net-snmp). The older ucd-snmp is currently replaced by the name net-snmp and also has many upgraded features. Most people are encouraged to install net-snmp 5.x on new system installations, but Cyrus IMAP does not work against this.
I have not looked through the code, but it may be quite simple to get Cyrus IMAP to compile against net-snmp using the --with-ucd-snmp-compatibility mode. This generates headers that resemble the older ucd-snmp, and perhaps everything will just work?
Anyhow, just a thought! ;-)
Oh yeah, I'm using 2.1.15, but the bugbase only goes up to 2.1.13, so I chose that.

Created an attachment (id=222) Net-SNMP 5.0.x updates for CVS branch cyrus-imapd-2_2
Updates all SNMP code in Cyrus to compile against Net-SNMP 5.0.x instead of UCD SNMP. Patched only against CVS branch cyrus-imapd-2_2.

Changed version.
I don't think we want to make backwards-incompatible changes at this point, so any patch would want to work against both.
I'll look at this again when I get a chance.

I was going to try to make it work with both libraries when I created it, but I'm almost completely lost with autoconf and a very very shaky C coder, so I decided I would leave well enough alone with trying to get the logic correct to correctly compile against either library. If I can find the time over the next few days, I'll see if I can't get that logic into the code.
(From update of attachment 222) After reviewing things, turns out this was not the best approach to take.

Created an attachment (id=259) Net-SNMP UCD_COMPATIBLE patch
This patch modifies the ucdsnmp.m4, master.c, cyrusMasterMIB.c, and imap/Makefile.in to work with Net-SNMP that is compiled with "--enable-ucd-snmp-compatibility", while not changing the existing ucd-snmp capable code. Compiles fine against Net-SNMP 5.1, but not yet tested. Don't know if it breaks anything with UCD SNMP, although it shouldn't.

Created an attachment (id=279) (net|ucd)-snmp patch
This patch implements both net-snmp and ucd-snmp support. ucd-snmp support remains unchanged. net-snmp enhancements: - snmp master agent (snmpd) no longer needs to be started before cyrus. - cyrus will try to reconnect to the master agent if it goes away - new startup params for master -x snmp agentx socket -P snmp agentx ping interval
I test the change on Solaris 9 against net-snmp 5.1.1.

attachment.desc: Net-SNMP 5.0.x updates for CVS branch cyrus-imapd-2_2
